text: Teacheramma () is a 1968 Indian Tamil-language drama film directed by Puttanna Kanagal. The film stars Jaishankar, C. R. Vijayakumari and Vanisri. It was remade in Malayalam as Premashilpi. == Plot == A school teacher sacrifices her love for the sake of her friend. == Cast == * Jaishankar as Somuhttps://www.amazon.in/Teacher-Amma-Jaishankar/dp/B0061IJ330 * Muthuraman as Shankar * Nagesh as Kalimann * Vijayakumari as Sumathi * Vanisri as Chandrahttps://cinema.vikatan.com/tamil-cinema/120601-hema-choudary-speaks- about-the-health-status-of-actress-jayanthi * S. N. Lakshmi as Shankar's mother == Production == Teacheramma was directed by Puttanna Kanagal, produced by Subhalakshmi Pictures and written by Balamurugan. == Soundtrack == The soundtrack was composed by T. R. Pappa.https://www.discogs.com/TR-Papa- Teacheramma/release/6285531 == Release and reception == Teacheramma was released on 12 April 1968.https://vellitthirai.com/movie/%e0%ae%9f%e0%af%80%e0%ae%9a%e0%af%8d%e0%ae%9a%e0%ae%b0%e0%ae%ae%e0%af%8d%e0%ae%ae%e0%ae%be/ In the 1970s, M. G. Ramachandran – then the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu – personally appreciated Vijayakumari for her performance. The film was commercially successful.https://www.maalaimalar.com/Cinema/CineHistory/2017/07/25215430/1098503/cinima- history-vijayakumari.vpf == References == == External links == * * *Teacheramma full movie in YouTube Category:Indian films Category:Indian drama films Category:Films directed by Puttanna Kanagal Category:Films scored by T. R. Pappa Category:Tamil films remade in other languages Category:1968 drama films
title: Teacheramma
